Phoenix (Testnet) (Legacy) Background watcher Alerts you if you need to start the app. Should be high priority. (Legacy) Missed payment notifications Notifies you when an incoming payment has failed because automatic on-the-fly channel creation has been disabled. (Legacy) Phoenix running in background Notifies you that Phoenix is running in background. This happens when someone is sending you money and the app is not already started. Creating your wallet… We could not create your wallet.\nReason: %1$s Do not import a seed that was NOT created by this application.\n\nAlso, make sure that you don\'t have another Phoenix wallet running with the same seed. I understand. Next Your wallet\'s seed is a list of 12 english words. Use the keyboard below to enter the seed: Restoring your wallet… Import This seed is invalid and cannot be imported.\n\nPlease try again Unlock to continue Cancel Device is not secure (code: %1$d) Please enter your PIN ●●●●●● PIN code must be a 6 digits number. Unlock Binding service… Loading… Starting Tor… Restart Settings The application could not start.\n\nError details: %1$s The application could not start. The address of the custom Electrum server is not valid.\n\nGo to Settings > Electrum to fix your settings. The Tor service could not start. Check that your connection is working and try again.\n\nError details: %1$s Wallet data could not be read, please restart the application Your internet connection is not working. Please check your WiFi or cellular network. PIN is incorrect Biometric authentication has failed. Enroll a fingerprint in Android first to unlock the wallet.\n\nOtherwise, restore your wallet using your 12-words seed backup. Authentication failed. Authentication failed.\n—\n%1$s Sending… Processing… Waiting… Failed - + No description Closing #%1$s On-chain payment to %1$s Edit my invoice You can change the requested amount and the description of the invoice. Please hold… There was an error when generating the invoice…\n\nPlease try again. Amount (optional) Payment description (optional) Phoenix payment Create invoice Payment requested Share this payment request with… Share… Your wallet is empty. First payment you receive must be at least %1$s. Channel creation has been disabled. You may not be able to receive some payments. Channel creation has been disabled. You will not be able to receive any payments. Address Use LNURL link Show a Bitcoin address This is a swap address. It is not controlled by your wallet. On-chain deposits sent to this address will be converted to Lightning channels.

Deposits must be at least %1$s. The fee is %2$s%% (%3$s minimum). Could not get a Bitcoin address from the swap service.\n\nPlease try again later. Unavailable

Please try again later. Service disabled

The on-chain deposit swap service has been disabled.

Try again later. Service disabled

The Bitcoin mempool is congested and fees are very high. The on-chain deposit swap service has been temporarily disabled.

Try again later. Requesting a Bitcoin address… Receive with a Bitcoin address A standard Bitcoin address will be displayed next.

Funds sent to this address will be shown on your wallet after one confirmation.

A %1$s%% fee will be applied (with a %2$s minimum). Balance: Send all Checking payment… This payment is not valid. You may have scanned an incorrect invoice.\n\nPlease try again. This payment has already been paid. Open payment Please enter a valid amount. Amount exceeds your balance. Min. %1$s for on-chain payment. Max. %1$s for on-chain payment. Must not exceed twice the requested amount Amount must be at most %1$s Send to Desc. What are those fees? Sending on-chain requires a swap and incurs mining fees. The feerate used for the transaction is fixed by the swap service.

More info here. There was an internal error when trying to send this payment. No money was sent. Pay The swap service for paying on-chain addresses has been disabled.\n\nPlease use a third-party service. Preparing transaction Swap to chain has failed. Please try again. Prepare transaction Amount Miner Fee Total Total after fees exceeds your balance. Manual input Paste from clipboard Load image from disk Extracting payment data… Manual input Enter a Bitcoin address, a Lightning invoice, a LNUrl, or a Lightning address you want to send money to. Enter the payment request here Grant camera permission Scan a QR code containing a payment request, a Bitcoin address or a LNURL Reading data Payment has expired. You cannot pay yourself. This payment does not use the same blockchain as your wallet. This type of Lightning URL is not supported yet! The service %1$s returned an error. The service %1$s returned a %2$d HTTP error code. It may not support this type of LNUrl. The service %1$s returned a %2$d HTTP error code. The service %1$s returned an error:

%2$s The service %1$s returned an invalid message. Invalid data.\nPlease try again. Warning This invoice doesn\'t include an amount. This may be dangerous: malicious nodes may be able to steal your payment. To be safe, you should ask the payee to specify an amount in the payment request.

Are you sure you want to pay this invoice? Confirm Cancel ≈ %1$s %1$s%2$s%3$s %1$s%2$s%3$s %4$s !? Ok Proceed Next Cancel just now N/A Unavailable Copied to clipboard! Go back OK Confirm Cancel Close Connecting to peer… Connecting to electrum… General Display Security Migration Recovery phrase App access settings Advanced Fees Settings Channels list Logs Electrum server Close all channels Danger zone Tor About Payment options and fees Upgrade to latest version Please start Phoenix A cheating attempt has been detected. Phoenix needs network access The background watcher needs internet to function properly. Phoenix is running in background Missed incoming payment A pending payment has been fulfilled Payment received App is locked Tap to start the app Channel creation requires manual approval Received %1$s (%2$s) Payment missed A new channel was needed to receive this payment. Tap here to enable automatic channel creation. Missed payment (%1$s) The amount incoming was too small to create a new payment channel. Close channels Checking channels, please hold… You currently have %1$d Lightning channels with an aggregated balance of %2$s. You currently don\'t have any channels that could be emptied.\n\nGo to the \'List channels\' page to see the state of your channels. Empty wallet Use this feature to empty your wallet to a Bitcoin address. Funds can be sent to a Bitcoin wallet. Make sure that the address is correct before sending. Enter Bitcoin address Empty my wallet Force close Force close allows you to unilaterally close your channels.

This feature is not a "fix everything magic button"; it is here as a safety measure and should only be used in extreme scenarios. For example, if your peer (ACINQ) disappears permanently, preventing you from spending your money. In all other cases, if you experience issues with Phoenix you should contact support.

Force closing channels will cost you money (to cover the on-chain fees) and will cause your funds to be locked for days. Do not uninstall the app until your channels are fully closed or you will lose money.

Do not use this feature if you don\'t fully understand what it does. Funds will eventually be sent to: This address is derived from your seed and belongs to you. Force close channels Are you sure you want to proceed? There was a problem. Please try again later. Funds sent. Please wait… Channels List Please hold… There was an error when retrieving the list of channels. Please try again. Node id: %1$s You don\'t have any channels yet. You have %1$d channel. You have %1$d channels. Copy Share all channels… Share Tx See funding transaction Close Channels data Share channel data Could not retrieve channel data Retrieving channel data… Could not retrieve the details for this channel. Please try again later. Balance Capacity Settings Send Receive I have read and agree with
the terms of usage. Create new wallet Restore my wallet +%1$s incoming FAQ Connecting… Tor enabled Stores Show all… Thanks for using Phoenix. Please backup your wallet so that you don\'t lose your bitcoins. Backup my wallet Phoenix needs to be able to run in background from time to time. Make sure your device does not aggressively kill this app for battery savings. An update for this app is available. A critical update is available. The wallet may malfunction if not updated. Bitcoin mempool is full and fees are high. See how Phoenix is affected Phoenix can upgrade to a new better version. Prepare migration Wallet recovery phrase Display seed Unlocking seed… Could not unlock seed, please try again. PIN is incorrect. The backup phrase, known as a seed, is a list of 12 english words. It allows you to recover full access to your funds if needed.

Only you alone possess this seed. Keep it private.

Do not share this seed with anyone.
Beware of phishing. The developers of Phoenix will never ask for your seed.

Do not lose this seed.
Save it somewhere safe (not on this phone). If you lose your seed and your phone, you\'ve lost your funds. BIP39 seed with standard BIP84 derivation path #%1$d %2$s I have made a backup of my seed, for example on a piece of paper. KEEP THIS SEED SAFE.\nDO NOT SHARE. Application logs Here you can extract and share the application logs. View logs… View logs with… Share logs… Phoenix App logs Share Phoenix logs… Retrieving payment details… There was an error when retrieving the details for this payment.\n\nPlease try again. Sent %1$s Pending… Payment failed.
No money has been sent. Payment has not been received yet. Received %1$s Desc. Add note You can attach a note to this payment. Sent to Relayed by Fees Fees This fee covers the cost of opening a new payment channel. Error Payment for closing channel %1$s… Payment to on-chain address No description Address Show in explorer This payment happened following a conflict in a channel. Funds will be sent to your on-chain address: %1$s.

To recover your funds, follow the FAQ instructions. Service Message %1$s

Open Link %1$s
%2$s Message from service could not be decrypted. Show details Recipient is not reachable, or does not have enough inbound liquidity. Payment rejected by the recipient.\nThis usually occurs when the invoice has already been paid or when it contains an expiration date, and you attempted to send a payment after the expiration. No route found with current fee setting. Try with higher fees. Edit my fee setting Payment data Swap fee rate Closing type Mutual closing Local Remote Other Closed channel Closing transactions Target public key Payment Hash Payment Request Preimage Created at Completed at Funding tx is being confirmed Channel is closing Channel has been closed Up and running Synchronizing with peer Peer is offline Shutdown Security We recommend enabling the screen lock to prevent unintended use of your wallet. Your device does not support hardware backed user authentication. Your biometric hardware is not available. Please enroll a PIN/Schema/Fingerprint in Android first. An Android security update is required. Not supported by your version of Android. Too many attempts, try again later. Unable to get cipher: %1$s Authentication failed. Screen lock Lock access to the app with Android\'s screen lock/fingerprint Enroll a fingerprint in Android for additional security features. Confirm that you\'ve backed up your recovery phrase for additional security features. Access my recovery phrase Prevent background execution App requires manual user unlock to run. Autonomous background payment reception is therefore not possible.\n\nOnly fingerprint authentication is supported. If your fingerprints are modified, you\'ll need to reinitialize Phoenix with your seed. Make sure to have a backup! Notice Background features will be disabled. To receive payments the app will have to be unlocked. You can use your wallet to anonymously sign and authorize an action on:

%1$s

No personal data will be shared with this service. Sign-in Signing-in to\n%1$s Authentication success. Authentication failure.\n\nDetails: %1$s Could not connect to %1$s Service responded with %1$s legacy_ Payment requested by
%1$s Description Add optional comment You can attach a comment to the payment (max %1$d characters). It will be sent to the recipient. No comment Pay Requesting invoice… Checking invoice… Sending payment… Amount must not be empty Amount must be at least %1$s Amount must be at most %1$s Amount exceeds your balance Invalid amount No payment sent. The service \'%1$s\' is not reachable, please check your connection. The service \'%1$s\' provided an invalid invoice (%2$s). The service \'%1$s\' returned an error (%2$s). Try again. Amount to receive Details You are redeeming funds from
%1$s. Redeem Redeeming funds… %1$s will send you the funds, it can take some time.\n\nKeep the app online. Could not redeem the payment. Please try again. This request to redeem payment is invalid. Please try again. Amount is invalid. Amount must be at least %1$s. Amount cannot exceed %1$s. %1$s returned an error, or an invalid response.

Try again later, or contact their support. The withdrawal may have failed. %1$s returned an unreadable response.

Try again later, or contact their support. The withdrawal failed. %1$s returned a %2$d HTTP error code.

Try again later, or contact their support. The withdrawal failed. %1$s returned the following error:

—
Try again later, or contact their support. Display options Bitcoin unit Fiat currency Application theme Onchain explorer Show balance in home Hiding balance helps against prying eyes Electrum server By default Phoenix connects to random Electrum servers in order to access the Bitcoin blockchain. You can also choose to connect to your own Electrum server. Set server… Block height Tip timestamp Fee rate Master public key %1$s\n\nPath: %2$s %1$s sat/byte Server Not connected You will connect to %1$s Establishing connection… Establishing connection with %1$s… Connected to: %1$s Use a custom server Server must have a valid certificate Also check certificate for this Onion address Server address (host:port). Please enter an electrum server address Add whitespace Delete last character Tor Settings You can improve your privacy by only using Tor when connecting to an Electrum server or to your Lightning peer. This will slightly slow down the application startup. Tor is enabled Tor is disabled Are you sure you want to disable Tor? Are you sure you want to enable Tor? Note that for best result, it\'s recommended to start a new wallet as well. Connections status You have some connection issue(s). The app will not function properly. Internet Electrum Tor Lightning Peer Connected Connecting… About Version: %1$s (%2$d) Phoenix is a Bitcoin wallet using the Lightning network for sending and receiving payments.

It is a free open source software, developed by ACINQ under the Apache 2.0 License.

Note that this wallet is non-custodial: you have sole custody of the wallet\'s 12-words seed. Do not give this seed to anyone, and beware of phishing.

If you have questions, consult the FAQ. You can also contact support for help. Bitcoin/fiat exchange rates are retrieved from various third-party APIs:
- Blockchain.info
- Bitso
- Powered by Coindesk Terms of usage Privacy Service containing the wallet\'s node. Payment options and fees Set various options and fees for payments you send or receive. Incoming payment description No description set… Default description Payment requests that you create will use this description. You can override it on a case-by-case basis. Enter a description Incoming payment expiry Payment expiry Payment requests that you create will use this expiry time (in seconds). Default value is 1 week. Enter an expiry, in seconds %1$s seconds Maximum fee for outgoing Lightning payments %1$s + %2$s%% Override default fee for outgoing payments Base fee (satoshi) Enter a base fee in satoshi Proportional fee (%) Enter a proportional fee in % Enter a valid maximum fee setting Base fee cannot exceed 50 000 sat. Proportional fee cannot exceed 100%. Automatic on-the-fly channel creation New channel will be opened when needed, a fee will apply (see below) Incoming payments that require a new channel will be rejected and will fail Fee for on-the-fly channel creation %1$s%% (%2$s minimum) On-the-fly channels This fee applies when you receive a payment over Lightning and a new channel needs to be created.

See the FAQ for more information. ●○○ ○●○ ○○● Welcome! With Phoenix, receiving and sending bitcoins is safe, easy, and fast. Automatic channel creation Payment channels are automatically created when needed.

The fee is %1$s%%
with a minimum: not less than %2$s.

For example, to receive 250 000 sat, the channel creation fee would be %2$s. I understand Keep control A backup phrase is generated, storing all the information needed to recover your Bitcoin funds.\n\nKeep it safe and secret! Get started Phoenix has been updated!

Background payment reception

Phoenix is now able to receive payments even if the app is not started.

Automatic channel creation

Payment channels will be automatically created for you if needed.

This feature is required for the background payment reception to work properly, but you can disable it if you want (in Settings > Payment settings).

The channel creation cost still applies (%1$s%%).

Improved wallet lock

The app lock now uses the system\'s lock. No need to remember yet another PIN!

Go to Settings > Security to enroll for the new screen lock feature.

Fee increase for new channels

The fee rate for new channels stays the same (%1$s%%), but there is now a %2$s minimum fee.

Pay on-chain On-chain transactions are typically slower and more expensive Pay with Lightning This is the recommended option Manual channels import This screen is a debugging tool that can be used to manually import encrypted channels data.\n\nUse with caution. Enter channels data here Import Reading channels data… Decrypting channels data… Writing channels to database… %1$d channel(s) successfully imported.\nThe app must now be restarted. Restart Failed to import channels: %1$s\n\nMake sure the data are correct and try again. data are not valid. could not decrypt data. could not write channels to database. Phoenix upgrade Upgrade to the latest version of Phoenix, with a cutting-edge Lightning engine and new features.\n\nYour channels will be merged together. This process is automated.\n\nAfter migration is complete, do not re-use your old swap-in addresses. Upgrade Connecting… Not now You cannot upgrade now: an on-chain deposit is pending.\n\nTry again later when this deposit has confirmed. You cannot upgrade now: some channels are currently being opened.\n\nTry again later when these channels have been opened and are active. You cannot upgrade now: some channels are being force-closed.\n\nTry again later when these channel have been completely closed. Note that force-close can take several days to complete. You cannot upgrade now because you are disconnected from Lightning and/or Electrum.\n\nTry again later when connection has been established. Confirm migration %1$d of %2$d channels are empty, or hold less than the Bitcoin dust limit (546 sat).\n\nThey will be closed, their balance if any will go to the Bitcoin miners, and their inbound liquidity will not be preserved. Proceed Cancel Processing migration… Connection lost.\nKeep the app in the foreground. Getting migration address Reviewing channels Closing channels (%1$d/%2$d) Publishing transactions (%1$s/%2$d) Migration complete Switching to the new app… Upgrade has failed Some or all channels may not have been migrated.\n\nThe upgrade process must be started again. Phoenix could not generate a valid address for the migration.\n\nThe upgrade process must be started again. Some channels could not be closed.\n\nThe upgrade process must be started again to migrate those. My payments (%1$d)
